content:
35. ‘ “It is not good that the man should be alone; I will 
make him a helper fit for him.’’ ’ 
After this statement, the first thing God did was to 
A. form beasts and bird and bring them to the 
man 
B. take one of the man’s ribs and close up its 
place with flesh 
C. make a rib into a woman and bring her to the 
man 
D. cause a deep sleep to fall upon the man. 
 
36. Joseph’s brothers decided not to kill him because 
A. pleaded with them 
B. was loved by their father 
C. was their brother and their flesh 
D. was the first son of his mother 
 
37. King Saul ordered that those who had opposed his 
ascent to the throne should not be put to death because 
A. God had wrought deliverance in Israel 
B. They had fought bravely in battle 
C. They had been reconciled with him 
D. God had forgiven their evil intentions 
 
38. After Saul realized that God would have nothing to do 
with him, he sought the help of 
A. Achish B. a prophet C. Samuel D. a medium. 
 
39. A promise made by king Saul to anyone that could face 
and defeat Goliath was 
A. giving his daughter in marriage to the person 
B. making the person second in command in Israel 
C. giving the person part of his land 
D. making the person the captain of his army. 
 
40. The LORD said to Moses that the people should gather 
just a day’s portion of bread so that He might test their 
A. self-control B. patience 
C.   obedience D. faith. 
 
41. What were the Israelites asked to do before meeting 
with God on Mount Sinai? 
A. To be consecrated have their garments washed 
B. To touch the border of the mountain 
C. To fast and have their feet washed 
D. To fast, pray and be consecrated. 
 
42. ‘ “ To you I will give all this authority and their glory; 
for it has been delivered to me, and I give it to whom I 
will…”’ 
This statement was made during the 
A. ascension of Jesus 
B. sermon on the mount 
C. temptation of Jesus 
D. triumphal entry into Jerusalem. 
43. ‘ “ … Just so, I tell you, there is joy before the angels 
of God over on sinner who repents.’’ ’ 
Jesus made this statements after telling the parable of the 
A. prodigal son B. lost coin 
C. dishonest stewadD. lost sheep 
 
44. According to Luke, the leper healed by Jesus was 
commanded to 
A. go and show himself to his friends 
B. find out from the priest what he should offer 
C. tell people about the cleansing 
D. make an offering for his cleansing. 
 
45. After the great confession by Peter, Jesus charged the 
disciple to 
A. announce that the kingdom of heaven had c 
ome 
B. tell no one that he was the Christ 
C. go away from the crowd to rest 
D. beware of the leaven of the Pharisees. 
 
46. The Angel of the Lord told Zachariah that the son 
would 
A. make the disobedient repent of their sins 
B. turn may of the sons and daughters of Israel 
to God 
C. go before God in the spirit and power of Elijah 
D. turn the hearts of the children to their father. 
 
47. When they returned from their mission, the seventy 
reported that 
A. their needs were fully met 
B. even Samaritans accepted their message 
C. they saw Satan fall like lightning 
D. even demons were subject to them 
 
48. “Take heart, it is I; have no fear.’’’ 
This statement was made by Jesus when 
A. He appeared to two disciples on the way 
to Emmaus 
B. He was walking on the sea in the night 
C. Mary Magdalene saw him at the sepulehre 
D. The women saw Him after resurrection 
 
49. “… Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is 
coming…” 
The declaration above was made by the crowd during 
the 
A. triumphal entry into Jerusalem 
B. feeding of the four thousand 
C. Passover feast 
D. Transfiguration of Jesus 
 
50. After healing the man at the pool of Bathzatha, the 
Jews sought all the more to kill Jesus because 
A. they hated the man that was healed 
B. he did his on the Sabbath 
C. they were unhappy that he healed the man 
D. he claimed that God his father was still working
